gobblin.runtime.fork

Class Fork

  • java.lang.Object
    • gobblin.runtime.fork.Fork
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FinalState, Closeable, AutoCloseable, Runnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsynchronousFork, SynchronousFork

    public abstract class Fork
extends Object
implements Closeable, Runnable, FinalState
    A class representing a forked branch of operations of a Task flow. The Forks of a Task are executed in a thread pool managed by the TaskExecutor, which is different from the thread pool used to execute Tasks.

    Each Fork consists of the following steps:

    • Getting the next record off the record queue.
    • Converting the record and doing row-level quality checking if applicable.
    • Writing the record out if it passes the quality checking.
    • Cleaning up and exiting once all the records have been processed.

        public abstract Optional<BoundedBlockingRecordQueue.QueueStats> queueStats()

        Returns:
        a BoundedBlockingRecordQueue.QueueStats object representing the record queue statistics of this Fork wrapped in an Optional, which means it may be absent if collecting of queue statistics is not enabled.
